doc.repnme: Transcript of oral history interview with Bernard R. Bell held on November 13, 1985 and January 28, 1988
doc.abstracts: In November 1985 and January 1988, Bernard R. Bell was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by Robert W. Oliver. During his tenure at the Bank from 1965 to 1977, Mr. Bell worked in the following areas: in the projects department as assistant director of economics (1965-1967) and as deputy director (1967-1968); in Indonesia as director of resident staff (1969-1972); in the East Africa region department as vice president (1972-1974); and in the East Asia and Pacific (EAP) region as regional vice president (1974-1977). Mr. Bell also talks about his pre-World Bank experience as chief economist of the Export-Import bank in the United States. His transcript concerns his ambitions for the World Bank to expand the volume of lending to developing countries, a goal later achieved under the direction of World Bank president Robert McNamara.
